text:
[cid:]
On a windows 11 machine, when I put in the local group policy 
Computer configuration
Administrative templates
Windows components
Microsoft Edge 
Reboot 
The resulting registry key shows up 
Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00 
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\MicrosoftEdge\Main]
"PreventFirstRunPage"=dword:00000001 
[cid:] 
Yet there is a registry key called 
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge which is where I've seen it
stated to put this entry 
But the 'tattoo' that group policy hits is
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\MicrosoftEdge\Main 
I like to know both group policy as well as registry for purposes of Intune. 
[cid:] 
This all started when I launched a clean Windows 11 22H2 laptop and realized how
many screens one has to go through on Edge just to get to a spot to download a
different browser.
%40c271dbec.com

metadata.topic: Re: Is the registry key for controlling Edge MicrosoftEdge or just plain Edge?
metadata.subject: Re: [patchmanagement] Re: Is the registry key for controlling Edge MicrosoftEdge or just plain Edge?
